title: How can you get the most utils for your money

content.question: Assume a consumer is spending all her income on two goods: X and Y. At the current consumption combination of the two goods, if the marginal utility per dollar spent on the last unit of good X exceeds that of the marginal utility per dollar spent on the last unit of good Y, what should the consumer do to maximize utility?

choices.label: Purchase more units of X and more units of Y.
Decrease the price of good X.
Purchase more units of X and less units of Y.
Increase income to buy more of both good Y and good X.
Nothing; utility is maximized at current consumption bundles.

content.answer: Purchase more units of X and less units of Y.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
